name: Western Sahara Resource Watch
goal: WSRW's principal purpose is to monitor and comment about the taking of natural resources from the Non-Self-Governing-Territory of Western Sahara, and to address related human rights abuses and environmental protection issues.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Budget, Climate Action, Consumers, Customs, Energy, Enlargement, External Relations, Food Safety, Foreign affairs and security policy, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: WSRW works to influence key decision-makers to ensure that EU policies affecting Western Sahara and the UN peace process pertaining to the territory, are carried out in conformity with legal principles under international law that are applicable to Non-Self-Governing-Territories. Our work spans policy areas that include International Trade, Development, Fisheries, Human Rights, Foreign Affairs and Consumer Affairs, among others, with a particular focus on EU-Morocco and EU-Maghreb relations.
